section-content.text:
[Buy Tickets](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/beat-farm-2020-tickets-98855536571?aff=eand)

Nobody is making money here. Tickets are just a way for us to pool resources so that we can make it a great experience.

### Basics

#### Where

Turning Earth Farms at [17585 Gardner Rd. Dallas, OR 97338](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Turning+Earth+Farms/@44.840048,-123.388839,15z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x0:0xce615d5149c3ac77!8m2!3d44.840048!4d-123.388839).  It’s about an hour and 20 minutes from Portland, outside of Salem.  To give you an idea of what typically goes on at the farm, check out this video: <https://vimeo.com/187775426>

#### When

Thursday July 16th to Sunday July 19th. You can arrive anytime starting Thursday to help setup. Music will begin on Friday. You have to pack everything out and leave on Sunday.

#### Arrival

You’ll see a sign at the gate that says Turning Earth Farms. If the gate is closed, open the gate to enter and make sure to close the gate behind you. There are animals running around the farm so if you use a gate, leave it as you found it. Follow the road past the main house, and there will be some volunteers helping direct you to where to park. You’ll park just a little ways outside the forest, but you’ll need to transport your things a couple minutes to your campsite by foot. If you think you’re going to arrive late at night, please let someone else attending know so we can look out for you.

#### Camping

There’s plenty of space to setup your camp in the woods. People working on the farm will be camping closer to the entrance to the forest but Beat Farm will have the bulk of it. There is a bonfire area near the stage. No smaller campfires.

### Rules & Safety Info

In order to provide a fun, safe and sustainable experience for all out guests, we ask you to adhere to the following guidelines:

1. **Leave-No-Trace** - Prepare to pack out any garbage, recycling or food waste that you bring in or create while at the festival and clean up after yourself after using any amenity. We encourage the use of reusable items and will have a small (very rustic) dish washing station available.
2. **Respect Your Surroundings** - We are guests of Turning Earth Farms and the rich ecosystem it encompasses. Be gentle when you engage with property, livestock, and natural features.
3. **Prevent Conflict** - If you find yourself in an situation that makes you feel unsafe or uncomfortable find and report it to a Beat Farm organizer
4. **Play At Your Own Risk** - Turning Earth Farms is NOT liable for any injuries or lost or stolen items during your stay.

### Amenities

**River** - There are several locations to wade and swim in the chilly stream that runs through the property.

**Camp Kitchen** - We will provide a small shared kitchen space for you to cook meals with a flat top grill, camp stove and makeshift dish washing station. If you need additional resources for preparing your meals Turning Earth Farms has an outdoor kitchen located near the farmhouse. Leave-No-Trace principles should be practiced in both these areas.

**Waste Stations** - Turning Earth Farms has 2 compost toilets on the South side of the camping area. There are also porto-potties located on the North side of the camping area.

### Theme Days

**Friday**: Animal House

**Saturday**: Intergalactic Odyssey

Other options: Western, Camp Colors, Rainbow, Nature, Pajama party, tight and bright, safari, jungle, anything but clothes, super hero, tropical, superstars, science, under the sea,

### About Turning Earth Farms

[https://www.turningearthfarms.​org](https://www.turningearthfarms.org/)

> We are dedicated to creating an environment in which you feel uninhibited while playing a role in a sustainable community. With your help we can build a creative hub that respects the earth, using alternative farming methods while reaping the benefits of localized agricultural production.
>
> Whether you come to the farm with specific ambitions, or want to join whatever the certain moment has in store, we are interested in your contributions! Allow the land to become your muse and let your creativity flow while you gain valuable life experiences surrounded by the breathtaking Oregon countryside.

accordion.title: What about toilets?
accordion.content: We will have 2 porta potties near the entrance to the woods. There are also composting toilets in the woods and there will be instructions on how to use it posted on the toilets. Please keep in mind this may mean putting non-compostable items in the trash, not the toilet. There is also a toilet near the outdoor kitchen, which is near the main house (3-5 minutes walk from the woods).

accordion.title: Showers?
accordion.content: No showers, but there is a small creek you can cool off in.

accordion.title: What’s this about an outdoor Kitchen?
accordion.content: Yep, there’s a very large outdoor kitchen near the main house we can use, along with a large walk in cooler. It’s a short walk from where we’ll be in the forest, but would be great for making meals. We’ll also have grills near the action by the stage, and feel free to bring your own if you wish.

accordion.title: Are you providing any food or drink?
accordion.content: We’ll have happy hours and snack hours throughout the weekend (grilled cheese sandwiches, smoothies, etc.)

Yes. There will be some fruits and vegetables available at the farm as well as goodies up at the outdoor kitchen-Bread, cheeses, pickled items and such.  There are donation boxes located at the farm and in the outdoor kitchen folks can drop cash into for veggies etc
accordion.title: Is there food we can eat from the farm?

accordion.content: No. You will see some dogs at the farm, but because of an incident a few years ago where a guest’s dog got loose in the chicken coop and killed a couple dozen chickens, you aren’t allowed to bring your dog.
accordion.title: Can I bring my dog?

accordion.content: Yes, there are 2 water stations on the property, and we’ll have additional jugs near the stage.
accordion.title: Will there be water stations?

accordion.content: Nope! We will have some trash and recycling bags set up around the stage area.  This is a true pack-it-in-pack-it-out event, and if anyone with a truck or extra space can take a few extra bags on the way out it would be very appreciated.  Keep that MOOP out of here, and you can never been too fucked up to recycle.
accordion.title: Can I just throw my trash everywhere?

accordion.content: Come ready to have fun, game it up, get weird, dance your ass off and de-stress.
accordion.title: How can I help?

accordion.content: Hammocks and lights! We have way more lights ready for this year but it always helps to have more. For yoga, bring a mat.
